title: totalcryptonoob
author: totalcryptonoob
created_time: July 30, 2023, 06:39:01 PMLast edit: July 31, 2023, 10:16:38 AM by totalcryptonoob
content: Hey guys I know I am new here and I dont expect much and if you dont want to help me its justified but I just need a 5$ loan to cover up something.I will give back 6$ in 24 hours I can offer same value 5$ as USDT as collateral

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: totalcryptonoob on July 30, 2023, 06:39:01 PMHey guys I know I am new here and I dont expect much and if you dont want to help me its justified but I just need a 5$ loan to cover up something.I will give back 6$ in 24 hours What type of collateral do you offer for your loan? By the way, the loan amount is so low that I am not sure if it will even be profitable for anyone to fulfill it, considering the transaction fees to and fro.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: 5 minute old account at the time asking for a loan?Even if it's one dollar, you are getting nothing except negative feedback. Try friends, family. If you messed up your relations with them due to loan defaults to an extent that they now can't help you, then that's bad for you

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Quote from: totalcryptonoob on July 31, 2023, 10:16:03 AMI can offer same value 5$ as USDT as collateralYeah but the network fees would make your loan really unprofitable, don't you think so ? What are you searching ? BTC ?

comments.body: Quote from: iwantmyhomepaidwithbtc2 on July 31, 2023, 02:33:29 PMQuote from: totalcryptonoob on July 31, 2023, 10:16:03 AMI can offer same value 5$ as USDT as collateralYeah but the network fees would make your loan really unprofitable, don't you think so ? What are you searching ? BTC ?yes i need 5$ in btc

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: totalcryptonoob on July 31, 2023, 03:32:15 PMQuote from: iwantmyhomepaidwithbtc2 on July 31, 2023, 02:33:29 PMQuote from: totalcryptonoob on July 31, 2023, 10:16:03 AMI can offer same value 5$ as USDT as collateralYeah but the network fees would make your loan really unprofitable, don't you think so ? What are you searching ? BTC ?yes i need 5$ in btc The network fee for BTC is currently around $0.50, and for USDT, it is at least $1. If we multiply that by two (for both ways), that's about $3 just for fees. Who is going to pay for it?

comments.author: totalcryptonoob
comments.body: i can pay 6$ in USDT if i get at least 4.50$ in BTC
